review: The Apple TV has actually replaced a cable subscription for me.  I only watch a few shows, and I can grab these easily either through the iTunes store, Netflix, or Hulu.  This saves a ton of money versus a complete cable subscription, plus all of the content is available on demand, so there's no need to remember to DVR-record anything.  You can also generally avoid commercials, or at least limit them (in the case of Hulu).I also use the Apple TV to stream music through iTunes which is great day to day but also for parties.  The album artwork shows up on the screen which is a nice addition.This is a product that I use every day and would recommend highly to any of my friends.

review: I bought this to act as my Netflix and MLB.tv player. Xbox Live became too expensive to maintain, and not worth the price even if it were cheaper, given that I probably play video games less than ten times a year. The Xbox's network adapter (I have an older one) is pretty subpar as well.Enter Apple TV, the golden child of streaming devices. It's simple, clean of cumbersome wires and remote buttons, and fast. The network adapter inside is receptive enough to stream with few pauses or buffers. You get bouts of that stuff occasionally, but such is the nature of wireless networks. The menu is very comprehensive, and offers many features. The Netflix app is great, and you can stream music and videos directly from any other Apple product. If you're watching a video on your iPhone, or iPad, you may throw that puppy up on the TV and watch there instead.I do wish that you could download apps onto the menu. Also, be careful with the remote. Dropping it once, or banging it onto anything, can scratch or ding it very easily.
